name: determinable
content:
determinable adjective
(CLEAR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal If something is determinable, it can be decided or the facts about it can be discovered: We need determinable performance targets based upon clear business criteria. At this time, the final outcome of this case is not determinable. Related word
determine
More examplesFewer examplesThere was no obligation to pay a fixed or determinable amount of money. The answer is not easily determinable from the wording of the article and requires some background.This technique can identify the origin of a mass not determinable from an ultrasound scan.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Decisions and deciding
determinable adjective
(ENDED)
law
  specialized able to be terminated (= ended officially) in particular situations: A yearly tenancy is determinable by the landlord or the tenant at the end of the first year. The complainant had been given a licence to use a patented invention, determinable on non-payment of the fee.
More examplesFewer examplesNormally there could be no doubt that this was an ordinary tenancy, determinable by a week's notice.
